nodes.bodyText: Channels with dates for CO2 are missing ?

@@ -121,19 +121,71 @@ Number Netatmo_Indoor_CO2 "CO2" <carbondioxide> { channel = "netatmo:NAMain:home

 |---------------------|----------------------|----------------------------------------------------------|

+| MinCo2ThisMonth     | Number:Dimensionless | Minimum CO2 this month                                   |
+| MaxCo2              | Number:Dimensionless | Maximum CO2 on current day                               |
+| MaxCo2ThisWeek      | Number:Dimensionless | Maximum CO2 this week                                    |
+| MaxCo2ThisMonth     | Number:Dimensionless | Maximum CO2 this month                                   |

nodes.bodyText: This import looks strange. Maybe a more standard Java type could be used ?
This import looks strange. Maybe a more standard Java type could be used ?
This import looks strange. Maybe a more standard Java type could be used ?
Is there a good reason it is not implemented like in other classes (using addMeasurement) ?

This module only has a single measurement for both week and month. I could have implemented the same as the others, but it basically adds some unnecessary code where the measurement is added to a list then the list is checked to see if it contains items before calling getMeasurements.
This import looks strange. Maybe a more standard Java type could be used ?
You did not add the methods channelLinked and channelUnlinked to this class ?
Move this block of channels relative to humidity just after the humidity channel.

nodes.bodyText:
You put Item=xxx in all lines.
The expected syntax is Text item=xxx

Please move this block just before humidex and so just after humidity.
To be coherent with other thing types.

nodes.bodyText: I am not sure that channel BatteryVP exists. Can you please check and fix the example.
An IllegalArgumentException is more appropriate here.
I'm not sure this is something to throw an exception over. Maybe you could just log it and then exit early.
These are going to be errors that should only occur during development.
Is there any way to put these methods in one of the handler parent classes instead of defining a utility class? Or do all the classes that call this not share the same hierarchy?

nodes.bodyText: The modules are grandchildren of AbstractNetatmoThingHandler, I moved it there.  It does appear that thermostat could take advantage of these methods as well.

nodes.bodyText: Is it still required now that you declared this method in AbstractNetatmoThingHandler ?
Yes, its needed in NAMainHandler to tell it's modules to update.  It could be moved back to NetatmoModuleHandler, but shouldn't hurt to be here.
Are you sure this is called on handler startup? If it isn't then channelIds will never get populated if channels are already linked when the handler get initialized.

nodes.bodyText: Can't you just check if a channel is linked or not by calling isLinked(...)? Then you don't need to track all of the linked channel ids.

Ah, nvm, I see you still need it for the method above. In that case is there a way for you to abstract the linked channel id tracking logic into this class so that all the subclasses don't have to implement it?
No, the channels that you can get measurements are unique by device and module.
This is already included in the parent class so you can remove this.
Is this not a common problem anymore?
No it was fixed in a prior PR.
You can remove this as well, there are no other modifications to this file
